summary:
KMD Brands Trading Update – Key Points:

  • Sales Performance (unaudited YOY changes for 10M to May 2025):
  • Group: -0.5% (1H: +0.5%; 2H to date: -1.9%).
  • Kathmandu: -1.0% (early June rebound: +13.2% YTD).
  • Rip Curl: +0.4% (strong DTC but weak wholesale).

  • Oboz: -4.1% (wholesale improving, online variable post-US tariffs).

  • Operational Highlights:

  • Kathmandu’s online sales +26.1% post-platform upgrade (May 2025).
  • Group online sales +10.7% YTD; new platform rollout for Rip Curl/Oboz in 1H FY26.

  • Gross margin down 140bps YOY due to competitive pricing.

  • Financial Guidance:

  • FY25 EBITDA: $15M–$25M (US tariff impact: ~$1M).
  • Net Debt (July 2025): ~$70M; working capital tightly managed.

  • Banking covenants amended for next two periods; compliance expected.

  • Key Risks: Unpredictable US tariffs, weather-dependent Kathmandu sales.

No capital markets actions (e.g., raising, halt) identified.

Appendix 3C - Buy-back Notification Summary
- Type: On-market buy-back (up to 5% of issued shares).
- Total shares bought back to date: 155,439 (before previous day) + 37,570 (previous day) = 193,009 shares.
- Total consideration paid: AUD 93,572.11 (cumulative) + AUD 19,524.59 (previous day).
- Price range (previous day): AUD 0.510 (low) to AUD 0.525 (high).
- Buy-back period: 13/5/2025 to 29/4/2026.
- Broker: Ord Minnett Limited.

Key Impact: Incremental liquidity reduction (0.19% of issued shares repurchased to date). No material change to capital structure.

• Disclosure Type: Movement of 1%+ in substantial holding (Steven Newman & NMC Trustees).
  • Key Changes:
  • Steven Newman: Reduced stake from 7.290% (13,474,111 shares) to 5.347% (10,020,952 shares).
  • NMC Trustees (via NMC Investment Trust): Reduced stake from 7.195% (13,297,083 shares) to 5.257% (9,853,024 shares).
  • Recent Transactions:
  • Sold 2,000,000 EROAD shares (13 June 2025) for A$2.82m (on-market).
  • Earlier sales from Feb 2024–May 2025: 1,444,059 shares for A$1.35m.

No material capital markets or liquidity impacts beyond stake dilution.

Summary of Material Information:

  • Strategic Energy Reserve Agreement: Non-binding term sheet signed by Genesis, Mercury, Meridian, and Contact to retain Huntly Power Station’s Rankine Units (scheduled for retirement) to support national energy security.
  • Key Reason: Addresses supply risks from declining gas supply, low hydro/wind conditions, and future renewable intermittency (KPMG review supports need until 2035).
  • Timeline: Proposal aims for implementation by 1 January 2026, with final decision required by early November 2025 to ensure readiness.
  • Commercial Model: Similar to prior "Huntly Firming Options"; may include biomass transition from coal.
  • Regulatory Engagement: Genesis has consulted Commerce Commission; agreements remain non-binding.

Omitted: Background details, contacts, boilerplate.
